author: Jill O'Rourke
title: Britney Spears Spends 'Best Christmas of My Life' with Her Sons
text:
Britney Spears Spends â€˜Best Christmas of My Lifeâ€™ with Her Sons
Reading Time: 2 minutes
Britney Spears had a lot to celebrate this Christmas, as she apparently spent the holiday with her two sons, Jayden James and Sean Preston. Spears posted a video with Jayden on Instagram, calling it the â€œbest Christmas of my life.â€
Britney Spears Spends Christmas with Her Sons
On Wednesday, Spears posted a video to Instagram in which she can be seen with her son Jayden, 18. â€œThis is my baby,â€ she tells the camera before giving Jayden a kiss on the cheek. In another clip, they sit at a table by a fireplace, wishing everyone a merry Christmas.
â€œBest Christmas of my life!!!â€ Spears wrote in the postâ€™s caption. â€œI havenâ€™t seen my boys in 2 years!!! Tears of joy and literally in shock everyday koo koo crazy so in love and blessed!!! Iâ€™m speechless thank you Jesus!!!â€
Although Spears mentioned her â€œboysâ€ in the post, she didnâ€™t share any photos or clips of her older son Preston, 19. However, The Daily Mail reports that he was also present with his mom for the Christmas festivities. A source said they surprised Spears for the holiday.
SEE ALSO: BRITNEY SPEARS IS â€˜MUCH HAPPIERâ€™ AS SHE REUNITES WITH SON JAYDEN
Spears Reunited with Jayden Earlier This Year
Christmas was apparently not the first time Spears spent time with Jayden this year. TMZ reported in November that they had reunited in person, after Jayden and Preston reportedly wished Spears a happy Motherâ€™s Day on the phone in May.
A source recently shared that Spears â€œseems much happier than she was last year,â€ adding of her reunion with Jayden, â€œHeâ€™s open to mending the relationship with his mom and seeing where things go. Britney was very excited to hear from him; [it] means everything to her.â€
Spears had previously been estranged from her sons since 2022, when they chose not to attend her wedding to ex-husband Sam Asghari. They later moved to Hawaii with their father, Spearsâ€™ ex-husband Kevin Federline.

title: La Vall dâ€™Aran Ã©s declarada reserva de la biosfera per la Unesco
text:

La Unesco, en una gala feta a Agadir, al Marroc, ha reconegut la Vall dâ€™Aran com a reserva de la biosfera. El Consell General dâ€™Aran havia treballat durant quatre anys aquesta candidatura.
La candidatura dâ€™Aran com a reserva de la biosfera es va proposar com una eina per preservar i recuperar les activitats tradicionals alhora que es fomenta polÃ­tiques de despoblament i transiciÃ³ cap a un model rural mÃ©s resilient, alhora que es facilita lâ€™harmonitzaciÃ³ del desenvolupament sostenible amb la gestiÃ³ econÃ²mica i la preservaciÃ³ del patrimoni cultural i valors naturals. La proposta havia presentat un equilibri entre qÃ¼estions ambientals, socioeconÃ²miques i culturals, alhora que pren una importÃ ncia destacant la preservaciÃ³ de la llengua, la cultura i el patrimoni dâ€™Aran. El reconeixement va mÃ©s enllÃ  dâ€™un segell turÃ­stic, perquÃ¨ reconeix internacionalment la Vall dâ€™Aran com a territori per desenvolupar estratÃ¨gies i accions que contribueixin al desenvolupament sostenible.
La sÃ­ndica dâ€™Aran, Maria VergÃ©s, ha assegurat que â€œaquesta distinciÃ³ per part de la Unesco Ã©s un fet histÃ²ric que reforÃ§a el nostre compromÃ­s que com a govern mantenim amb lâ€™Aran i la seva gentâ€ i ha assegurat que â€œesdevenir reserva de la biosfera de la UNESCO tambÃ© Ã©s un important reconeixement a la lÃ­nia dâ€™actuaciÃ³ i el projecte de paÃ­s que estÃ  duent a terme el govern del Consell General dâ€™Aran tot reafirmant que anem en el bon camÃ­ per fer dâ€™Aran un territori amb futur per als seus ciutadans, i aixÃ­ liderar al Pirineu un conjunt dâ€™estratÃ¨gies per al desenvolupament sostenibleâ€.
A partir dâ€™ara, una vegada rebuda la notificaciÃ³ oficial del reconeixement, el govern dâ€™Aran, ha de dur a terme reunions informatives amb les administracions i entitats araneses per presentar les primeres actuacions a desenvolupar, entre els que ja inclouen projectes com lâ€™actual Pla de Sostenibilitat TurÃ­stica, BoscAran o Ovihuec.

title: Perdue Farms hit with 90-day notice to stop PFAS pollution or face a judge - NewsBreak

author: world today news
title: Burgas Mayor Honors Top Students
text:
In a â¢heartwarming ceremony held on the eve of Burgasâ€™s patron saint day, â¢Nikulden, Mayor Dimitar Nikolov honored the cityâ€™s brightest young minds. â€The sixth annual awardsâ£ ceremony,â€‹ held at the Congressâ€ Center, celebrated â£the exceptionalâ¢ achievementsâ¢ ofâ€Œ Burgas students â¢in academics, science, sports, and the arts.
This yearâ€™s ceremony â€‹was particularly special, â¢with a record-breakingâ€Œ 640 students achieving â€‹topâ€‹ honors in national and international competitions. Mayor Nikolov lauded the dedication â€of teachers, parents, and students, callingâ€Œ it â€a â€œtriple holiday.â€
â€œThis year we have a record â€“ 640 talentedâ€ children â€have won first â£places at national and fromâ£ first to third place at international competitions. This is â¤aâ€ triple holiday â€Œ- a â€‹holiday for teachers,â€ because during the year they persistently stood by the children and â€‹supported them,â€Œ encouraged them,â£ cleaned up all the â€Œweaknessesâ¢ soâ€Œ that theyâ€‹ could reach the top. The second party is for parents,grandparents who haveâ¤ supported thier talents â€‹and initiatives. They stoodâ¢ behind themâ€Œ in everyâ¢ challenging moment outside the â€Œschool building and encouraged them.And the third isâ¢ for the â¤children themselves!â€
Mayorâ€ Dimitar Nikolov Mayor Nikolov expressed hisâ£ hope that these talented young Burgas residents woudl choose to â€stay in Bulgariaâ¢ and contributeâ¢ to theâ€‹ nationâ€™s future. He emphasized â€‹the importance of â€nurturing â¤local talent andâ¤ fostering a brighter future for the country.
â€œI â€Œwouldâ¤ be more happy â€‹if they stay in Burgas,â¤ in Bulgaria to develop this talent. A time will come when Bulgarian â£talentsâ€Œ will stay here, create and develop science, educate others, and then our country will â€have an even better future. I dreamâ¢ of this moment!â£ thank you, dear children, for your efforts! The Municipality â¢of Burgas supports and stands â€‹behind â€‹each â€‹and every prosperous young fellow citizen of ours! On the eve of Nicholas Day, I wishâ¢ you aâ€‹ happy holiday!â€
Mayorâ£ Nikolov The ceremony commenced with â¢the â€prestigious â€œStudent of theâ€‹ Yearâ€ award presented to Taisia Zenkovic,â€‹ a student at the Burgasâ¤ Free University.
## â€ Investing in the Future: A â¢Conversation withâ€‹ Mayor Nikolov on Recognizing Burgasâ€™ â€Young â€Achievers
**World Today News:** â€ Mayor Nikolov, thankâ¤ you for taking â¢the time to speak with us today. the annual awards ceremony honoring Burgasâ€™s brightest young mindsâ€Œ is a truly â¢inspiring event. Can you tell us moreâ£ about â€its significance?
**Mayor nikolov:** It is myâ¤ pleasure. Thisâ€‹ ceremony is moreâ¤ than just â¢handing out awards. Itâ€™s about investing in the â€Œfuture of Burgas.â¤ These young people â€“ the students who excel in academics, science, sports, and the arts â€- represent the vibrancy and potential of our city. Byâ€Œ recognizing their achievements, we â¤are notâ£ only celebrating their â¢individual successes but also encouraging â¤a culture of excellence and ambition among all our young citizens.
**Worldâ¢ Todayâ€‹ News:** How does the city of Burgas support these young achievers beyondâ¤ the award ceremony itself?
**Mayor Nikolov:** We believe in providingâ¤ a thorough ecosystem for nurturing talent. This includes strong educational institutions, â€Œwell-equipped facilities for sports and arts, and mentorshipâ£ programs connecting young people withâ¤ experienced professionals. We also â£actively seek partnerships with businesses and â€Œorganizations to offer internships and scholarships, bridging the gap â£between education and real-world experience.
**Worldâ£ Today â€ŒNews:** â€Œthe ceremony â¢coincided with theâ€ eve of Burgasâ€™s â€Œpatron saint day, Nikulden. Is there â¤a symbolic connectionâ€‹ between celebratingâ€‹ the â£cityâ€™sâ€‹ patron saint â€‹and honoringâ£ its young achievers?
**Mayor Nikolov:** Absolutely. nikulden is aâ€ day â€‹of reflection and gratitudeâ€ for the blessings bestowed upon our city.What better way to express our gratitude than byâ¤ celebratingâ£ the â¤very essence of Burgasâ€™s future â€“ its â€young people? Theirâ¤ achievements are a testament to the spirit of innovation, perseverance, and community thatâ¢ defines our city.
**Worldâ¢ Today â€‹News:**â€Œ Lookingâ€ ahead, whatâ€Œ are your hopes and aspirations for these burgeoningâ€‹ talents?
**Mayorâ¢ Nikolov:** We aspire to see these young people become leaders â€‹in theirâ€ chosen fields â€“ not â€‹just for Burgas, but for â¢Bulgaria and the world. We want â€‹them to be â¢proud â£ambassadors of our â€Œcity,â¢ showcasing their talents and contributing to a brighter future for all.
**World Today News:**â€‹ Thank you, Mayor Nikolov, for your time andâ£ insights. This event â¢is a true testament to the commitment of Burgas to â¤nurturing its future.
â¤**We wish all â¤the awardees continued success and radiant futures.**

author: Rita Nazareth - Bloomberg
title: AI craze is driving Nasdaqâ€™s best run since 1999
text: A banner year for stocks is drawing to a close, with gains in Big Tech leaving the market near all-time highs amid exuberance for artificial intelligence and dovish bets on the Federal Reserveâ€™s next moves. In the run-up to the final closing bell of 2023, the Nasdaq marched toward its best year since 1999 amid a $7 trillion surge. The benchmark S&P 500 is approaching a record and was roughly 1% below the average full-year gain predicted in a recent survey with analysts, who forecast the index would end 2024 at 4,833. â€œIf the stock market can break through that record high in any significant way as we move through January, itâ€™s going to be very bullish on a technical basis,â€ said Matt Maley at Miller Tabak and Co. â€œWhenever the market is rallying strongly at the beginning of a new year â€“ when a lot of people are adjusting their investment game plans â€“ it tends to exacerbate the rally.â€ In a rates-obsessed world, the stock market saw a massive reversal this year after suffering its worst annual selloff since 2008. As traders ramped up bets that the Fed is done with its hiking campaign â€“ and will start easing policy in 2024 â€“ global bonds are set for their biggest two-month gain on record. On Thursday, the S&P 500 traded just a few points away from its all-time high of 4,796.56 â€“ extending its 2023 advance to 25%. Treasuries dropped after a weak $40 billion sale of seven-year notes. The dollar rose against most of its developed-market peers. The yen climbed as Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda continued to prepare the ground for the nationâ€™s first rate increase since 2007. From Nvidia to Microsoft, the seven largest U.S. tech stocks were responsible for 64% of the gaugeâ€™s rally this year through last week as the AI frenzy took off. The Nasdaq is up 55% this year. The â€œMagnificent Sevenâ€ â€“ which also includes Amazon, Apple, Google parent Alphabet, Meta and Tesla â€“ are expected to post 22% earnings growth next year, twice the S&P 500â€™s advance, data compiled by Bloomberg Intelligence show. The key is how much of that is already baked into share prices, especially with expectations for a soft landing building. â€œCompanies that have a defined and clear AI strategy with easy-to-follow metrics will likely continue to do well in 2024,â€ said Michael Landsberg at Landsberg Bennett Private Wealth Management. â€œCompanies that have a hard time explaining their AI value proposition will not see a repeat of 2023, where most large tech was buoyed by the excitement and not necessarily the details of AI.â€ Investors have flocked to Big Tech in part on bets that they are best positioned to capitalize on AI due to their vast scale and financial strength. Those bigger profits have brought valuations down from nosebleed levels â€“ but theyâ€™re still lofty. The Nasdaq is priced at about 25 times profits projected over the next 12 months, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. While thatâ€™s down from a peak of 30 in 2020, itâ€™s well above the average of 19 times over the past two decades. Although there has been a relatively high number of stocks with gains of over 100%, there havenâ€™t been many outperforming the S&P 500, Bespoke Investment Group noted. In a typical year, on average, 48.7% of the benchmarkâ€™s members post larger gains than the index itself. In 2023, less than 30% of its members are outpacing the index. â€œThis leads one to question whether the leaders (or laggards) continue to lead (lag) in the year ahead,â€ the Bespoke strategists said. â€œLooking at the past, the picture is not exactly favorable for that sort of rotation in either direction.â€ The market is â€œsitting on big gains,â€ and most participants just want the year to end to register those gains, said Tom Essaye, a former Merrill Lynch trader who founded The Sevens Report newsletter. â€œBut Iâ€™ve been in this industry long enough to know that when everyone seems to be leaning on one side of the proverbial canoe, it pays to move to the middle.â€ Warnings about a market thatâ€™s flashing overbought signals have been raising concern about a pullback, with some market observers saying that traders have gone too far, too fast in pricing in a dovish Fed pivot. While the recent ebbing of inflation is positive for the Fed, some other figures showing economic resilience could fuel consumer spending â€“ working against the central bankâ€™s aim to slow the pace of growth. That poses risks for the bond market heading into the new year. Falling yields have also driven the dollar lower in 2023, with the greenback on pace for its worst year since the onset of the pandemic. Much of the decline materialized in the fourth quarter on growing wagers that the Fed will sharply loosen policy next year. The drop in Treasury yields has effectively relaxed financial conditions in the U.S. and is â€œhardly compatible with sustainably low inflation,â€ said Ipek Ozkardeskaya, a senior analyst at Swissquote. â€œThe rally in the sovereign space looks overdone â€“ hence the rally in stocks and the selloff in the U.S. dollar look overstretched,â€ she wrote in a note. About a week ahead of the all-important U.S. jobs report, traders were unfazed by data showing initial jobless claims rose to 218,000. Economists forecast a still-healthy 170,000 increase in December payrolls, consistent with resilient labor demand that has been key in powering the economy. Bloomberg writers Richard Henderson, Robert Brand, Jessica Menton, Elena Popina, Ishika Mookerjee, Jeran Wittenstein and Carmen Reinicke contributed to this report. Success.
